Success for up-and-coming American writer/directors is a hit-and-miss business. This month's The Brothers Bloom was generally regarded as a letdown compared to Rian Johnson's first film, Brick

Pub

"Students weren't welcome here before," said the cheerful landlady as she pulled my pint of Timothy Taylor's

The Killer Inside Me

The sudden reputation for provocative, misogynistic brutality earned by Michael Winterbottom's latest release may have led to comparisons with Lars von Trier's Antichrist, but The Killer Inside Me's impact - such as it is - doesn't compare

Matisyahu

Having just released third LP 'Light' in the UK, Matisyahu talks to Mia de Graaf (Thumbnail credit Matisyahu relaxingwith his beard)

Pumping Iron

With effortless charm and less than perfect English, Arnold Schwarzenegger explains how he undermines his opponents in the 1975 Mr Olympia contest: "Franco is pretty smart, but Franco's a child. He comes to me for advices. So it's not hard for me to give him the wrong advices"

Never mind romcoms, make your first date a trip to Martyrs or Antichrist

The date movie is perhaps the worst genre Hollywood has to offer. So vast is the gulf between Valentine's Day, The Bounty Hunter and films someone in full possession of their mental faculties would actually want to see, that one must seek out other entertainment

Graduate Fashion Week

By James Bithell

MUSE's fashion team take a look at some of Britain's best graduate fashion at Earl's Court this June. GFW has already launched the careers of Stella McCartney, Christopher Bailey and Preen's Justin Thornton ... can you spot a new star here?

Sofia Redgrave

By James Bithell

Wimbledon by numbers

Wimbledon by numbers

MUSE: 22 June 2010

While I would usually attempt to fill this space with an amusing story about production, I seem to be struggling this edition. The funny has run out, some would say. I can only put this down to the fact that it's the last paper of the year and, as much as I try and deny it, it seems like a watershed in my NOUSE career (Thumbnail credit George Lowther)

Stone Circles and Pyramids: The Nouse Glastonbury Guide 2010

By James Bithell
